main event: A UFO was sighted over South-Central France on 17 August 1953, observed by military personnel as well as experienced pilots from the 55th Fighter Bomber Squadron, 20th Fighter Bomber Wing, and was described as bright metallic in appearance, traveling at high altitudes and speeds.
interesting points: The UFO was observed by credible and experienced witnesses, including Captain Walter G. Carter and 1st Lt. Thomas E. Saunders, both of whom were considered reliable pilots.
The object was estimated to be approximately 30 feet in diameter and was seen emitting light rays in intermittent bursts of varying intensity.
Unusual weather conditions prevailed at the time of the sighting, and no other air traffic was known to be in the same general area.
The total length of observation of the object was approximately 15 minutes, during which it accelerated and disappeared from view at an estimated altitude of 55,000 to 60,000 feet.
The report was part of Project Blue Book, the U.S. Air Force's investigation into UFO sightings and it remained unresolved within the Project Blue Book records.
sighted object: bright metallic spherical object emitting light rays
location: South Central France, near the village of St. Saturnin, a few miles north of Clermont-Ferrand
